author: sunnysidedj_42398
content:
Hi, please find our latest report on high blobs+regular tx, Perfect PeerDAS and more here https://testinprod.notion.site/Sunnyside-Devnet-Updates-08-04-2458fc57f546808ab2c9e34480e0b7a9?source=copy_link

Major findings are:
- `60 blobs/block under 22M gas usage` (blobs+regular tx) on 120-node Interop Devnet. Additional gas usage and larger block size had minimal impact on the bandwidth usage and max blob throughput.
- Only `20 blobs/block with bandwidth limits under 22M gas usage` (100/50Mbps Supernode & 50/25Mbps Fullnode)
- Perfect PeerDAS (16 8-validator nodes uniquely custodying each column) achieved `60 blobs/block under 22M gas usage` & `30 blobs/block with bandwidth limits`
- Genesis sync failed on Perfect PeerDAS network from Fulu epoch
- Found an issue with Tekuâ€™s backfill, being fixed by Teku as per previous Discord. Waiting other CLs to support backfill

author: manunlp
content:
<@931591385545584640> it seems Lodestar is not compatible with the latest Fulu spec regarding dataColumnsByRoot requests.
https://github.com/ChainSafe/lodestar/blob/fusaka-devnet-3/packages/beacon-node/src/network/reqresp/handlers/dataColumnSidecarsByRoot.ts#L34-L41

This spec change: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/4394

author: manunlp
content:
What I get:
```
[2025-08-04 16:56:27.61]  WARN sync: Received incomplete data column sidecars by root response agent=lodestar/v1.32.0 blockCount=26 peerID=16Uiu2HAm6KJEd2bM2pkGoLazGmGQ5oDWFsKNMXmhGmgmXqR9niBL totalReceivedCount=0 totalRequestedCount=37
```
(In this case incomplete = nothing at all)
